DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Identification of the radar station from which the data are received.
Type and characteristics of the target report.

DataItemFormat.desc: Variable length Data Item comprising a first part of oneoctet, followed by one-octet extents as necessary.

Bits.BitsValue: Plot or track from a fixed transponder

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Warning/error conditions detected by a radar station for the target report involved.

DataItemFormat.desc: Variable length Data Item comprising a first part of one octet, followed by one-octet extents as necessary.

Bits.BitsValue: Mode C code/Mode S altitude code abnormal value compared to the track
Duplicated or Illegal Mode S Aircraft Address
Undecodable Mode C code / Mode S altitude code
Mode 1 was present in original reply
Mode 2 was present in original reply
Plot potentially caused by Wind Turbine

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Measured position of an aircraft in local polar coordinates.
Calculated position of an aircraft in cartesian coordinates
Reply to Mode-2 interrogation

Bits.BitsValue: Mode-2 code as derived from the reply of the transponder
Smoothed Mode-2 code as provided by a local tracker

DataItem.DataItemNote: Smoothed Mode-2 data (bit-14 set to one) is used when the plot contains no Mode-2 code or the Mode-2 codes of the plot and track are different. 2. Bits-16/15 have no meaning in the case of a smoothed Mode-2 and are set to 0 for a calculated track.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Reply to Mode-1 interrogation

Bits.BitsValue: Mode-1 code as derived from the reply of the transponder
Smoothed Mode-1 code as provided by a local tracker

DataItem.DataItemNote: This item is optional. When used, it shall be sent when: 1) Mode 1 is present. Then, it represents the Mode 1 code for the plot, even if associated with a track. 2) Mode 1 is absent and local tracking is performed. It shall then be sent with the bit-6 (L) set to one..... Bit 7 has no meaning in the case of a smoothed Mode 1 and is set to 0 for a calculated track.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Confidence level for each bit of a Mode-2 reply as provided by a monopulse SSR station.
DataItem.DataItemNote: This Data Item is only transmitted if at least one pulse is of low quality.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Confidence level for each bit of a Mode-1 reply as provided by a monopulse SSR station.
DataItem.DataItemNote: This data item is optional. When used, it shall be transmitted only when at least one pulse is of low quality. It represents the confidence level for each reply bit of the Mode 1 code of the plot.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Mode-3/A code converted into octal representation.

Bits.BitsValue: Mode-3/A code as derived from the reply of the transponder
Smoothed Mode-3/A code as provided by a local tracker

DataItem.DataItemNote: The detector signals a garbled code when at least two replies are overlapping or error corection has been attempted.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Confidence level for each bit of a Mode-3/A reply as provided by a monopulse SSR station.
DataItem.DataItemNote: This Data Item is only transmitted if at least one pulse is of low quality.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Flight level in Binary Representation
DataItem.DataItemNote: The detector signals a garbled code when at least two replies are overlapping or error corection has been attempted.

DataItem.DataItemName: Mode-C Code and Code Confidence Indicator
DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Mode-C height in Gray notation as received from the transponder together with the confidence level for each reply bit as provided by a MSSR/ModeS station.
DataItem.DataItemNote: This Data Item is only transmitted if at least one pulse is of low quality. 2. The detector signals a garbled code when at least two replies are overlapping.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Height mesured by a 3D radar, mean sea level is the zero reference level.
Information on the Doppler Speed of the target report.

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of one octet, followed by one of the two defined subfields.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Additional information on the quality of the target report

Bits.BitsName: Difference in Range between PSR and SSR plot
Difference in Azimuth between PSR and SSR plot

DataItem.DataItemNote: This Data Item may contain parameters such as plot runlength (primary and secondary), difference between primary and secondary derived azimuth, pulse amplitude, etc.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Absolute time stamping of the information provided in the track message, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
An integer value representing a unique reference to a track record within a particular track/plot file.
Status of monoradar track derived either from primary and/or secondary radar information.

DataItemFormat.desc: Variable length Data Item comprising a first part of one octet, followed by one-octet extents as necessary.

Bits.BitsValue: Low confidence in plot to track association

DataItem.DataItemName: Calculated Track Velocity in Polar Coordinates
DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Calculated track velocity expressed in polar coordinates.
Track Quality in the form of a vector of standard deviations.
24-bits Mode S address
Communication-ACAS Capability and Flight Status
Target (aircraft or vehicle) identification in 8 characters.

Bits.BitsName: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining target identification

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Mode S Comm B data extracted from the aircraft transponder
RA

Bits.BitsValue: There is more than one threat and the RA is intended to provide separation below some threat(s) and above some other threat(s) or no RA has been generated (when MTE = 0)
Either there is only one threat or the RA is intended to provide separation in the same direction for all threats
RA is preventive or RA does not require a correction in the upward sense
RA is corrective or RA requires a correction in the upward sense
Upward sense RA has been generated or RA does not require a positive climb
Downward sense RA has been generated or RA requires a positive climb
RA is not increased rate or RA does not require a correction in the downward sense
RA is increased rate or RA requires a correction in the downward sense
RA is not a sense reversal or RA does not require a positive descend
RA is a sense reversal or RA requires a positive descend
RA is not altitude crossing or RA does not require a crossing
RA is altitude crossing or RA requires a crossing
RA is vertical speed limit or RA is not a sense reversal
RA is positive or RA is a sense reversal
TID contains a Mode S transponder address
TID contains altitude, range and bearing data

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: SP
